a.title: Permalink to BCA Clinic in Dexter is Open

h2.a: BCA Clinic in Dexter is Open

div.p: Dear BCA families, We are open. Kids still get sick and babies need check ups and vaccines. We will schedule your visit to keep everyone safe. We can talk on the phone, over the internet, or in the office. Call us if you need us, we are here for you.…

article.class: post-1445 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to April School Board Meeting

div.p: The April School Board meeting will be held Monday, April 20 at 6:00pm via Zoom. If you would like to attend remotely or participate in public comment, please contact the Central Office at 575.752.3254 by 3:00pm Monday for connection information.

article.class: indexed post-1442 post type-post status-publish format-image hentry category-uncategorized post_format-post-format-image

a.title: Permalink to We Are Bobcat Strong

article.class: post-1440 post type-post status-publish format-link hentry category-uncategorized post_format-post-format-link

a.title: Permalink to Continuous Learning Plan begins today

div.p: A big thank you to parents, students, teachers and staff who have all been working together to help make the remainder of the school year successful. At this time we have reached 97% of families. If you have any questions regarding plan specifics like the how, when and where, please do not hesitate to contact your child’s building secretary or teacher. And during this time if there is anything we can do to help, please let us know.

Below are some great tools from Prepared Parents. We hope these, and their other resources (https://preparedforsuccess.org/covid19/) might help to make learning at home a bit better and less stressful.

p.strong: 🧰 Tool: How to start and end every day with a ritual
p.br: A Check-In is a morning touchpoint to recognize feelings and get grounded for the day. A Check-Out is an end-of-day touchpoint to share gratitude and takeaways. Download this tool to make check-in / check-out a part of your daily routine.

p.strong: 🧰 Tool: How to help your kid set and achieve goals
p.br: Goal-setting is an essential skill that helps kids find purpose and contribute to the world around them. Help your kid set and achieve goals with the Self-Directed Learning Cycle, whether those goals be around homework, passion projects, or individual responsibilities. Download this tool to transform micro-management into self-direction.

p.strong: 🧰 Tool: How to create real-world projects at home
p.br: Real-world projects are activities that engage your kids in hands-on experiences. Learn how to create real-world projects at home to help your kids develop new skills and habits, retain learning longer, and follow their innate curiosity. Download this tool to turn anything into a project, from schoolwork to family trip planning to chores.

h2.a: Update on Coronavirus (COVID-19) in New Mexico from Ricky Williams

div.p: I am writing to express my gratitude and appreciation for the methods that each of you have taken during this unusual time. To keep all children and staff safe, quick and difficult decisions have been made. As such, we are committed to monitoring new information and taking appropriate next steps…

article.class: post-1426 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to School Closure for Three Weeks

div.p: The Governor has ordered a school closure effective Monday March 16 for three weeks. School will be in session tomorrow. Information will be sent home and posted on our website as details are shared. School will resume April 6.

article.class: post-1423 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

div.p: Hagerman Elementary teachers were nominated for the Teacher of Character Award. Teachers were honored at a ceremony presented by Character Counts of Chaves County on March 3, 2020.
